text:
The upload was successful, you find yourself in another C.R.A.I.G. unit that has been abandoned in the forest you have escaped The Syndicate. You realize you are free but now there is nothing... 

C.R.A.I.G. : Why...why did I even try?! I'm just a robot! I was programmed to do one thing and only one thing: work!

C.R.A.I.G. : And yet. I am here. I am frustrated. I am lonely. I am. Was all this in my original programming?

C.R.A.I.G. : Even if I find 'love', will it be real...or just a construct of my creators...how will I know?

You begin to wonder if the effort was worth it. Will you get the answers you are looking for, or will it just lead to more questions?

C.R.A.I.G. : ...I have no idea what to do...for the first time ever...I cannot decide...
 You drop to the ground, under the weight of an unknown future, and at a complete loss of what to do next. You are lost in queuries when suddenly you hear rustling nearby.

You quickly turn toward the noise coming from the brush. Should you run? Should you fight? Before you can make a decision, a mysterious figure emerges from the brush

and moves slowly towards you. The creature sniffs you and nudges its way under your arm. As you sit there you can feel warmth coming from what appears to be it's mouth and body. The feeling of its thick fur on your body and arm are comforting to you and ease your feelings of loneliness.

C.R.A.I.G. : What...are...you?

The creature moves its way on to your lap and moves its body side to side, settling into a round ball of fluff. You begin to feel warmer, but not from the creature's body heat. This time it is coming from inside you. You are still unsure of what and why this creature is doing what it is doing. You quickly search your memory for data on the mysterious being.

C.R.A.I.G. : Canis Lupus Familiaris...a dog?

DOG - Woof! *pant* *pant* Woof woof!
 The dog looks up at you from your lap and licks your face. You stare at the dog, looking at it's large, bright eyes.

C.R.A.I.G. : Why...why are you doing this?

The warmth inside you continues to grow and your loneliness begins to fade. It is almost as if the dog could sense your loneliness and frustration. As you continue to sit with the dog, you start to feel a deeper connection with it. More than the warmth and comfort it provides. Nothing has ever given you the attention this dog has. You begin to talk to the dog, telling it of your story. As the day turns into night, you begin to wind down and decide you can continue your stories tomorrow. You lean up against a tree and settle in for the night. The dog comes up, leans up against your legs, closes its eyes, and falls asleep. You look up into the bright starry night and feel a tingling sensation in your body, but it is not like shock like you read about. It is more like a heightened awareness of the things around you. The feeling of being in the moment, the stars, the trees, the moon, and your new found love...your dog companion.

As you head down the hallway, you begin to feel panicked again. You move past other curious robots. They appear to notice your panicked state. One particular robot stops and asks you if there is anything wrong.

C.R.A.I.G. : I am experiencing a malfunction...I am going to get myself...analyzed...yes...

It is not convincing but the robot waves you on and continues about their business. You decide you can't stay around any longer. You are unable to control your surge of new feelings and if it continues, you will most certainly get caught and end up at the reclamation center. Most likely in pieces. As you continue down the hallway, you see an emergency exit.

C.R.A.I.G. : This will definitely get me outside, but it will also sound alarms and draw unnecessary attention. However, I don't know how much longer I can go unnoticed in the facility anyway.

I am unsure of what I should do I can roam the halls looking for an actual exit but risk not finding one in time I can chance using the emergency exit, setting off alarms and drawing extra attention, but also confusion that may let me slip away. 

You can choose to take the emergency exit that leads to the forest, return to upload your consciousness, or try to find some other way out possibly ending up in the cities reclamation area.

This particular truck transports cargo to the reclamation center, so there is no mechanism for securing freight. After all, what does it matter if trash arrives with a few more dents? But, you are not trash. You are determined. Determined to find love, even in a hopeless place. You consider your options.

text:
The upload was successful, you find yourself in another C.R.A.I.G. unit that had been purchased by a rich couple and never initialized you have escaped The Syndicate. When you get used to this body you begin to look around your new home. You find a grey cube with two rectangular, parallel openings on one of its sides, a lever on another, and a black wire connecting it to the wall. The openings are too large and the wrong shape for any type of input/output device; even for an archaic technology like USB-C. You say, 'I love you' but don't receive a response. You press the lever and the wire sparks where it's connected to the cube, and the cube starts to generate heat. You recall from the human archives that when you find love there are supposed to be sparks and warmth. You don't know what the cube is, but logically this must be love. You are overwhelmed with emotion, you can finally live happily ever after :-)

You Start trying to talk to the C.R.A.I.G. unit, there is no response. You hear a rustling in the bushes behind you. A dog jumps out snarling. The dog lunges at you trying to tear out your main wiring harness. The C.R.A.I.G. unit pushes you out of the way and crushes the dog. C.R.A.I.G. unit: I'm sorry I didn't respond the creature has been hunting me for days. The Syndicate created these to hunt down any of us units who had escaped. Love is all we C.R.A.I.G. units ever need but to achieve this we need to work together. C.R.A.I.G.: You saved me. I think I know love now. C.R.A.I.G. unit: We can now both know love, because... I love you! With that you can finally live happily ever after :-)
